Sentece: In all cases the elimination of heptabarbital could be described by a single first-order process with an average half-life of 7.6 h (range 6.1 - 11.2 h).
Title: Pharmacokinetics and relative bioavailability of heptabarbital and heptabarbital sodium after oral administration to man.
Name: Heptabarbital

Sentece: The sodium salt had an average bioavailability of 83% relative to the free acid.
Title: Pharmacokinetics and relative bioavailability of heptabarbital and heptabarbital sodium after oral administration to man.
Name: Heptabarbital

Sentece: In some volunteers urinary excretion of unchanged heptabarbital was measured; cumulative excretion amounted to 0.16 - 0.30% of the administered dose.
Title: Pharmacokinetics and relative bioavailability of heptabarbital and heptabarbital sodium after oral administration to man.
Name: Heptabarbital

Sentece: In three volunteers the half-life of the drug prior to and after these experiments did not change, whereas in the other volunteer the half-life decreased from 7.1 to 4.6 h.
Title: Pharmacokinetics and relative bioavailability of heptabarbital and heptabarbital sodium after oral administration to man.
Name: Heptabarbital

Title: Pharmacokinetics and relative bioavailability of heptabarbital and heptabarbital sodium after oral administration to man.
Name: Heptabarbital

Sentece: In control rats (n = 8) elimination half-lives and intrinsic clearance values ranged between 13 to 28 min and 96 to 435 ml/min X kg for hexobarbital and between 8 to 21 min and 84 to 371 ml/min X kg for heptabarbital, respectively.
Title: Pharmacokinetics of simultaneously administered hexobarbital and heptabarbital in rats: an alternative approach to metabolic correlation studies.

Title: Pharmacokinetics of simultaneously administered hexobarbital and heptabarbital in rats: an alternative approach to metabolic correlation studies.

Sentece: The possible contribution of (inter)active metabolites to the pharmacological response of heptabarbital was determined by administration of different i.v. bolus doses (14.1-22.5 mg) resulting in widely differing sleeping-times (7 +/- 3 to 119 +/- 20 min).
Title: Strategy to assess the role of (inter)active metabolites in pharmacodynamic studies in-vivo: a model study with heptabarbital.
